decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission. 
Condition : 2 - The use shall not operate other than between the hours of 9.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Saturdays, and not on Sundays, Bank Holidays and Public Holidays without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 3 - The massage/aromatherapy use on part of the ground floor, as shown on the approved drawing, shall be used for this purpose only and for no other purposes (including any other purpose in Class D1 of the Schedule of the Town & Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or any statutory instrument revoking or re-enacting that order with or without modification.
Condition : 4 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
Suitably conditioned to control hours of use, the proposed healthcare use is considered acceptable and would not harm neighbour amenity. 
This determination has been made having had regard to the policies contained in the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan (October 2003) so far as material to the proposals which are the subject of this approval. 
Merton Unitary Development Plan (2003)
C.9 (Provision of Health Facilities)
HP.2 (Retention of Residential Accommodation)
description: CHANGE OF USE OF PART OF THE GROUND FLOOR FROM RESIDENTIAL (CLASS C3) TO USE FOR MASSAGE/AROMATHERPY (CLASS D1)
